info.name: Monk - Way of the Demon Fist

description.p: Monks of the Way of the Demon Fist train ferociously in the art of martial combat. They learn ruthless techniques to grievously wound, incapacitate, or kill their enemies with blinding speed, harnessing their ki as a deadly weapon to bolster their power or devastate their foe.

sheet.description: Monks of the Way of the Demon Fist train ferociously in the art of martial combat.

description.p: Starting when you choose this tradition at 3rd level, you can manipulate the flow of your ki to duplicate the effects of certain spells, cursing an enemy or empowering yourself.
As an action, you can spend 2 ki points to cast Hold Person, Blur, Alter Self, or Blindness/Deafness at their lowest level without providing material components.
Additionally, you gain the Thaumaturgy cantrip if you don’t already have it.

sheet.description: As an action, you can spend 2 ki points to cast Hold Person, Blur, Alter Self, or Blindness/Deafness at their lowest level without providing material components. Additionally, you gain the Thaumaturgy cantrip if you don’t already have it.

description.p: At 6th level, your strikes become brutal, targeting pressure points, aiming to grievously wound or kill. You score a critical hit on a 19 or a 20, and any creature you strike with a melee attack can’t regain hit points until the start of your next turn.

sheet.description: You score a critical hit on a 19 or a 20, and any creature you strike with a melee attack can’t regain hit points until the start of your next turn.

description.p: By 11th level, your fighting spirit has become so intense that pain only fuels your frenzy. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to instantly make two unarmed strikes against any creature within 5ft of you.

sheet.description: When you take damage, you can use your reaction to instantly make two unarmed strikes against any creature within 5ft of you.

description.p: At 17th level, you gain the ability to devastate a foe by swiftly striking at multiple pressure points. If you hit the same creature with four or more melee attacks in one turn, at the end of that turn, that creature takes an additional 8d10 force damage and falls prone.
